placeMetadata.name: Shri Maa Chandi Devi Temple, Haridwar

sources.snippet: One of the most charming religious sites in Haridwar, perched on the Neel Parvat of the Shivalik Hills, the Chandi Devi Temple was erected in the year 1929 by the then king of Kashmir, and it is believed that the idol of the goddess inside the temple was installed as early as the 8-century. This is one of the most famous pilgrimages and lures devotees all around the year. The place is also known as Siddha Peetha, a place where devotees worship to fulfill their wishes.

sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Haridwar for Travelling Architect - Page 2 of 2

placeMetadata.description: Historic Hindu temple accessible by cable car offering picturesque mountaintop views.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Perched atop the Neel Parvat in the Shivalik Hills, Shri Maa Chandi Devi Temple is a historic Hindu pilgrimage site with a rich legacy. Built in 1929, it is believed to house an ancient idol of the goddess dating back to the 8th century. The temple attracts devotees year-round and is known as a Siddha Peetha, where worshippers seek fulfillment of their desires.

reviews.reviewText:
Visited Shree Ma Chandi Devi Temple on 20th April 2025. To reach the temple, we bought tickets for the ropeway service called Udan Khatola. Tickets were priced at ‚Çπ240 per person. It was quite hot that day, but the short ropeway ride ‚Äî just a few minutes from the bottom to the hilltop ‚Äî was comfortable and offered beautiful views.

The temple itself has a simple and peaceful architecture, which adds to its charm. However, be prepared for long queues at every step, from the ropeway boarding point to the temple entrance and inside the temple premises. Despite the crowd, the overall experience was spiritually uplifting.

The ropeway is well-managed, and the staff was helpful, but due to the heat and waiting time, it‚Äôs a good idea to carry water and maybe visit earlier in the day. Overall, a memorable visit to one of Haridwar‚Äôs most sacred spots!

Chandi devi temple located at hilltop of Neel Parvat was memorable experience. We went by ropeway to enjoy bird's eye view of Haridwar, Ganda river and  surrounding hills. Early Morning Trekking is also good option to enjoy panaramic view.

You can either buy combo of Mansa devi and chandi devi temple the only thing is you should be able to reach both temples on the same day if there's no long queues then it's easy. When we went in 2022 combo charges 324 rs per person while only chandi devi temple ticket charges 195 rs per person.

Temple is clean and well maintained. Temple premises contains idols of lord kali ma, sankat mochan hanuman, Maa Annapurna, Santoshi Maa etc. This siddhpeeth is heavy crowded on festive like Navratri and holiday season. There are waiting halls at each levels and quite nice dining cafe inside and children game area to spend sometime. You'll find beautiful dress photography studies at all places in haridwar rishikesh masoorie.

Chandi Devi Temple is highly revered by devotees as a Siddh Peetha which is a place of worship where desires get fulfilled. It is one of three such Peethas located in Haridwar, the other two being Mansa Devi Temple and Maya Devi Temple.

Goddess Chandi also known as Chandika is the presiding deity of the temple. The story of the origin of Chandika is as follows: Long time ago, the demon kings Shumbha and Nishumbha had captured the kingdom of the god-king of heaven - Indra and thrown the gods from Swarga (heaven). After intense prayers by the gods, a goddess emerged from Parvati. An exceptionally beautiful woman and amazed by her beauty, Shumbha desired to marry her. On being refused, Shumbha sent his demon chiefs Chanda and Munda to kill her. They were killed by goddess Chamunda who originated out of Chandika's anger. Shumbha and Nishumbha then collectively tried to kill Chandika but were instead slain by the goddess. Thereafter, Chandika is said to have rested for a short while at the top of Neel Parvat and later a temple was built here to testify the legend. Also, the two peaks located in the mountain range are called Shumbha and Nishumbha.

Maa Chandi Devi Temple is a serene and spiritually uplifting place located on top of Neel Parvat in Haridwar. The views from the temple are breathtaking, especially during sunrise. The ropeway (Chandi Devi Udankhatola) is well-organized and makes the journey convenient, especially for elderly visitors. It's about a 5‚Äì10 minute ride offering scenic views of the Ganga and surrounding hills. The temple is clean, well-maintained, and has a peaceful vibe. Darshan is usually smooth, but it can get crowded during festivals. A must-visit when in Haridwar

So there are two ways to reach here, one is a ropeway and the other one is a trek. If you're in a hurry, visiting on a sunny hot day, I would suggest going for the ropeway otherwise trek is also a good option. It has a scenic view but #*BEWARE OF MONKEYS*#

The temple is quiet and peaceful. Even on a weekend, the atmosphere and vibe is all heavenly and healthy. There won't be any rush if you go in early morning hours and there are plenty of shops where you can buy the "prasad" so don't stick on one and move forward. There are no charges for the show keeping and #Beware of pickpockets#

Few steps upward is another temple, if you're going here I'll suggest to visit that one as well. It is also very calm and peaceful

For the #parking
There is no such proper place. U might have to park on the road, near the hill or along the mountains.

For #ropeway
There are plenty of cable cars and hence your number will arrive soon. Even though you book online, you would have to wait and take ur number from here. A counter is present here, you can also buy tickets offline from there. If you are planning to visit mansa devi temple as well, I would suggest u to buy the tickets beforehand, either from this counter or online, cz there the crowd and rush is ü´°
Last but not the least, don't forget to buy the peda from here, the most loved prasad.

Jai Maa Chandi Devi. You need to take the cable car to reach this temple on the hill. Maa Anjani Devi temple too is located nearby. Enjoy the view from top. Several shops and eateries adorn the hill along the path way to the temple.

Visiting the Maa Chandi Devi Temple in Haridwar is a journey filled with devotion, peace, and divine energy. Situated atop the Neel Parvat on the eastern side of the Ganga River, this temple is one of the most revered Shakti Peethas and a must-visit for anyone coming to Haridwar.

The experience begins with either a ropeway ride (Chandi Devi Udankhatola) or a scenic uphill trek. The ropeway offers breathtaking views of the city, Ganga River, and lush hills ‚Äî it feels as if you're slowly ascending toward the divine. Once you reach the top, the calmness of the surroundings and the ringing of temple bells instantly create a spiritual atmosphere.

Inside the temple, the idol of Maa Chandi Devi, believed to have been installed by Adi Shankaracharya in the 8th century, is powerful and awe-inspiring. Devotees offer flowers, coconuts, and prayers with deep devotion. The temple priests are humble and guide visitors respectfully through the rituals.

It is believed that worshipping here helps one overcome obstacles, fear, and negativity. During Navratri and other special occasions, the temple sees thousands of devotees, yet it still holds a peaceful vibration that touches the heart.

The view from the temple is equally divine ‚Äî you can see the majestic flow of the Ganga and the holy city of Haridwar from above. The air feels fresh, and the spiritual energy is high.

In summary, Maa Chandi Devi Temple is more than a place of worship ‚Äî it‚Äôs a sacred experience of strength, surrender, and divine motherly love. A visit here brings not just blessings, but a deep inner peace. üå∏‚õ∞Ô∏èüôè

A truly divine experience at Shri Maa Chandi Devi Temple! Located atop Neel Parvat, the temple offers not just spiritual peace but also breathtaking panoramic views of Haridwar and the Ganga river. The energy here is powerful‚Äîit‚Äôs easy to feel a deep sense of devotion and calm in the presence of Maa Chandi.

The ropeway ride (Udankhatola) is well-managed and adds to the overall experience, especially if you‚Äôre visiting with elderly family members or children. For the adventurous, the trek uphill is equally rewarding and spiritually enriching.

The temple is clean, well-organized, and the priests are helpful but not pushy. Visiting during Navratri made the whole atmosphere even more vibrant and devotional.

placeMetadata.name: Har Ki Pauri

sources.snippet: Deemed as one of the most sacred Ghats in Haridwar and the whole of India, Har Ki Pauri is a revered landmark and is visited by a profusion of devotees and visitors seeking the blessings of the Holy Ganga. A dip in the magical waters of the Ganges here is believed to wash away one‚Äôs sins and according to the Indian mythology, the ‚ÄòBrahmakund‚Äô, where the evening and morning aarti take place is said to be one of the four places where the drops of Amrit were accidentally spilled by the celestial bird Garuda. In the evening, the river gets illuminated in golden hues of countless diyas and lighted candles offered by the devotees.

Located 1km from Har ki Pauri, the Bhimgoda tank is considered sacred for its mythological significance. It is a heritage site and one of the most must-visit places in Haridwar. As per mythologies, it is believed that Lord Bhima (one of the Pancha Pandavas) drew water from the rocks by thrusting his knee (goda) in this place.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Haridwar for Travelling Architect - Page 2 of 2

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Har Ki Pauri is a must-see in Haridwar, known as one of the most emblematic sites of the Hindu religion. It is famous for hosting the Ganga Aarti at nightfall, drawing thousands of faithful who gather to lay flowers or light candles on the banks of the Ganges. The ghat is surrounded by various bakery and cake shops, offering a variety of sweet treats and baked goods for visitors to enjoy after experiencing this spiritual and cultural landmark.

placeMetadata.name: Maa Mansa Devi Temple, niranjani akhadaHaridwar

sources.snippet: Mansa Devi Temple is one of the most famous Hindu temples dedicated to Goddess Mansa Devi, and one of the prime holy  places to visit in Haridwar. The Goddess is believed to be a form of Shakti and is considered to have emerged from Lord Shiva‚Äôs mind. The temple is also one of the ‚ÄòPanch Tirths‚Äô or the five pilgrimages in Haridwar and is perched atop the Bilwa Parvat on the Sivalik Hills.

placeMetadata.description: Perched on a hilltop, this ancient Hindu temple honors Mansa Devi, the folk goddess of snakes.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Maa Mansa Devi Temple, located in Haridwar, Uttarakhand, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Mansa Devi. Situated atop the Shivalik Hills, it is believed to be the abode of Goddess Mansa and holds great religious significance as one of the five auspicious pilgrimages in Haridwar.

reviews.reviewText: Jai Mansa Devi. A beautiful temple located on a hillock overlooking River Ganges, in Haridwar. Take the cable car and enjoy the scenic views enroute. Starting point for the cable car is located at 20 minutes driving time from Harki Pauri. You may also walk up till the base in the same time. The Base is too crowded with long queue for cable car tickets, shops and eateries. Take the cable car and enjoy the scenic views. Have a divine Darshan of Maa Devi and other devtas. Enjoy the experience of shopping enroute. No photography is permitted within the temple.

Situated on a small hill. There is rope car facility. We waited for 20 minutes to board the rope car. It was a long walk from parking to the gondola boarding. Travel is only 3 minutes. Very well organised. Lot of security personnel guiding the visitors. On the Top not much crowd on that day. We had easy darshan.
The Gondola tickets costs Rs 440 for both temples. One can choose also.
The Devi is divine. Radiates so much positivity and assurance.

Firstly pay price then only will be allowed to go near all god and goddess statue. If unable to pay then just see from far away. 4‚≠ê for scenery view of Mountain . It took only 1 to 1.30 hrs. To complete full trip.

The temple is serene on the top of the hill. We took the ropeway to reach the top. It costs 200 per person for the round trip. We get a glimpse of the city view from the ride that lasts barely 2-3 mins. There is a shoe stand just before the entrance of the temple ... So one need not leave it near any shop and then be forced to buy stuff from them. There is a coconut breaking area at the back... Otherwise all the pooja stuff we buy is dumped into a box. So avoid buying those small red bags for Rs.100. Darshan shall be quick and one will get ample time to see and pray mata ji. On the way back for ropeway users there is a small cafeteria with snacks at affordable prices.
Non consent photography for the pure intent of making money is something I dislike. They should have made this optional.

üå∏ Divine Experience at Mansa Devi Temple, Haridwar üå∏

Mansa Devi Temple in Haridwar is one of the most revered and spiritually powerful temples in North India. Situated atop the Bilwa Parvat on the Shivalik Hills, this sacred shrine is dedicated to Goddess Mansa Devi believed to be the wish fulfilling goddess. The word Mansa itself means desire, and it is said that devotees who visit the temple with true faith get their wishes fulfilled.

Every year, lakhs of pilgrims from across India and abroad visit this holy temple, especially during Navratri and the Kanwar Yatra. The energy, devotion, and peaceful surroundings create a divine atmosphere that‚Äôs hard to describe in words.

You can reach the temple either by trekking up the hill or via a ropeway, which offers a beautiful panoramic view of Haridwar and the holy Ganges, it will cost you 190 rupees for return ticket.

The temple not only holds deep religious significance but also showcases the deep-rooted culture and spiritual heritage of India. Tying a sacred thread on the temple tree while praying is a common tradition here ‚Äì a symbol of hope, belief, and faith.

A must visit for anyone coming to Haridwar. Whether you are a spiritual seeker, a believer, or simply someone who admires Indian culture, Mansa Devi Temple offers an experience that stays with you long after you leave.

üôè Har Har Gange! üôè

Mansa Devi Temple is a famous temple in Haridwar, located on top of a hill called Bilwa Parvat. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Mansa Devi, who is believed to fulfill the wishes of her devotees.

View from Haridwar: You can see the temple clearly from many places in Haridwar, as it sits high above the town. It looks especially beautiful in the early morning or evening.

How to Reach the Temple:

By Cable Car (Ropeway):
You can walk for about 10‚Äì15 minutes from Har Ki Pauri or the main Haridwar area to reach the ticket counter. It‚Äôs a short, easy walk through the market. The cable car ride is quick and gives you great views of the town and the Ganga river.

By Trekking:
There is a steep uphill path with around 1,000 steps. It takes about 30‚Äì45 minutes to reach the top if you go at a steady pace. The trek is tiring but gives you a peaceful experience through nature.

Tip: Carry enough water, wear comfortable shoes, and try to avoid trekking during hot afternoons. There are a few shaded spots to rest along the way, but not many stalls, so be prepared.

View from the Top: Once at the top, you‚Äôll see a beautiful view of Haridwar city and the river Ganga flowing through it. It‚Äôs a peaceful and spiritual place, often with cool breezes.

About the Temple: Inside the temple are idols of Goddess Mansa Devi in two forms. Devotees often tie threads to a holy tree near the temple, making a wish. When their wish comes true, they come back to untie the thread. You can offer coconuts, flowers, and prasad at the temple.

History: The temple was built in the early 1800s by Maharaja Gopal Singh. It is one of the five important pilgrimage spots (Panch Tirth) in Haridwar.
Quick Tips:

Best time to visit: Early morning or evening (to avoid heat and crowd).

Cable car tickets may have long queues during weekends and holidays‚Äîgo early.

Carry water, snacks, and a cap if you‚Äôre trekking.

Dress modestly and keep your belongings safe in the crowd.

Maa Mansa Devi is a beautiful temple located on a hillock overlooking the River Ganges in Haridwar. Many visitors take the cable car to reach the temple and enjoy the scenic views along the way, but I chose to climb the hill on foot. The walk was equally rewarding, offering glimpses of the surroundings and a spiritual sense of journey.
The starting point for the cable car is about 20 minutes drive from Har Ki Pauri, and you can also reach the base on foot in the same amount of time. The base area is usually very crowded, with long queues for cable car tickets, along with shops and eateries.
Whether you climb or take the cable car, the experience is memorable. At the top, you can have a divine darshan of Maa Mansa Devi and other deities. On the way, there are several stalls where you can shop for offerings and souvenirs. Please note that photography is not permitted inside the temple.

I recently visited Maa Mansa Devi Temple and it was a truly divine experience. The temple is very clean, well-organized, and has a peaceful spiritual atmosphere. The idol of Maa Mansa Devi is beautifully adorned, and offering prayers here feels very uplifting. The premises are spacious enough to accommodate devotees comfortably, and despite the rush, everything was well-managed.
You can reach the temple either by ropeway (‚Çπ400 per person for a round trip) or by walking. I chose the ropeway and enjoyed the smooth ride with breathtaking views of Haridwar city and the Ganga river. The darshan was well-arranged and did not take too long.
After visiting the temple, I explored Moti Bazar nearby for some shopping and later went to Har Ki Pauri to witness the Ganga Aarti, which made the entire trip complete and memorable. A must-visit place in Haridwar for blessings and peace of mind. üôè

placeMetadata.name: Maya Devi Temple, Haridwar

sources.snippet: Believed to have been constructed in the 11-century, the Maya Devi Temple is one of the important holy places to visit in Haridwar. The temple is one of the three Shaktipeeth located in the holy city of Haridwar and is dedicated to Hindu Goddess Maya, who is considered to be a form of Adi Shakti or Absolute Power. In ancient times, Haridwar was even called Mayapuri in veneration of this deity.

placeMetadata.description: Sacred Hindu sanctuary featuring colorful statues, dedicated to the Goddess Maya.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The beautiful and sacred Hindu temple of Maya Devi is dedicated to the goddess who is believed to be an incarnation of Shakti. The temple is one of the holiest places in Haridwar, and devotees believe that all their prayers are answered here. There are colorful statues of the goddess throughout the temple, and it is also said to be a place where people's wishes come true.
placeMetadata.address: Upper Rd, Birla Ghat, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

reviews.reviewText:
Haridwar is also known as Mayapur or Mayapuri and it is referred by this name is most of the ancient Hindu texts. This name is derived from the presence of the Maya Devi temple. If talk about Haridwar everyone tells immediately about Mansa Devi and Chandi Devi temple but very few knows about this temple, which is third peeth of three Siddh Peeths of Haridwar. This temple is located in a more residential area and market near Birla Ghat.

The ancient Maya Devi temple was established in the eleventh century along with The Narayana Shila temple and The Bhairav temple.

Interesting facts about Maya Devi temple:
1. In the main shrine of the temple one can see Maya Devi in the middle, Kali on the left and Kamakhya on the right as per mythology. It is said the heart and navel of Goddess Sati fell at this place. She is considered as the Adhishtadri mean Guardian deity of Haridwar.
2. Pradakshina path around the sanctum sanatorium of the Maya Devi temple has illustrations of the Dasha Mahavidyas which makes it highly importance in follower of Shaktism.
3. During your visit to Maya devi Mandir, you can also visit Anand Bhairav temple which is located in the same premises. Maya Devi and Anand Bhairav shrines are managed by Juna Akhara. There is free meal facility in the Afternoon and Evening.

Temple Visiting Timing:
Morning 06:30 to 12:00
Evening 03:00 to 09:00

Maya Devi Temple is a popular ancient temple in Haridwar and one of Siddh Peeth located in Uttarakhand. Goddess Maya, who is believed to be an incarnation of Goddess Shakti, is the deity of Maya Devi Temple.

Previously Haridwar was known as Mayapuri as Goddess Maya is the diety of Haridwar. Maya Devi Temple also completes the trio of Siddh Peeths in Haridwar. Other two Siddh Peeths in Haridwar are Chandi Devi and Mansa Devi temples.

Inner shrine of the temple has idols of Goddess Maya, Goddess Kali and Goddess Kamakhya. During Navratra and Kumbh Fair devotees in large number visit Maya Devi Temple to take blessings. Maya Devi Temple is located in Har ki Pauri in Haridwar and one can reach here by bus or auto rickshaw. Nearest railway station to reach Maya Devi Temple is Haridwar railway station..

Might be a little controversial but still I will write.
This place is very bad, the priest refused to give us prasad as we look poor but behind us there are 2 people who looks rich and the pandit given prasad to them but not to us.

Felt bad but it's a part of life
Divine place in Haridwar apart from Mansa Devi & Chandi Devi temple. If possible visit during morning or evening Aarti

üåü Maya Devi Temple, Haridwar üåü
A peaceful and sacred temple located very close to the Ganga River, near Birla Ghat in Haridwar. It‚Äôs one of the ancient temples in the city and holds great spiritual significance.

The temple is very clean and well-maintained, offering a calm and divine atmosphere for devotees and visitors. Inside, you can feel a deep sense of peace while seeking blessings from Goddess Maya Devi.

There is also a dharamshala (guesthouse) available nearby for those who wish to stay. It's simple but convenient, especially for spiritual travelers and pilgrims.

If you're visiting Haridwar, especially near Har Ki Pauri or Birla Ghat, I highly recommend taking some time to visit this temple.
Truly a divine experience!

Maya Devi temple is situated on the top of the hill.the decoration of the ma idol is very very attractive.there are two means of transport i.e.walk and rope way(cost is 199 and the combine cost including chandi temple is 349).for rope way there is vip ticket also which costs 649 for two temples.the worst thing is we have  to wait for 2-3 hrs for rope way but the darshan will happens in less than 5 minutes.we to wait again by standing(since there is no room to wait at the temple)  for rope way.much preferable is kalakand sweet which is available in the waiting hall of the rope way.

Maya devi temple _ this temple was built in 11th century and the temple is a siddh peeth
It means that whatever you wish for it gets ful filled

This is one of 3 shakti peeths located in Haridwar. May be people are not aware of it this is why it is very less crowded than remaining 2. The mandir is very humble , situated near post office , in Juna Aakara premise

placeMetadata.name: Bharat Mata Temple, Haridwar

sources.snippet: This is one of the most significant temples located in the heart of the city and is visited by people from all corners of the country. The temple is believed to be one of a kind as it is one of the few temples that are dedicated to Mother India and is touted as one of the greatest and most famous religious sites in Haridwar. The place is a beautiful spiritual retreat for all its devotees.

placeMetadata.description: This Hindu shrine dedicated to the goddess symbolizing India has a map of the undivided country.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Bharat Mata Temple, located in Haridwar, is a distinctive multi-storey shrine inaugurated by the late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 1983. Standing at 180 feet tall with 8 floors, it celebrates India's unity in diversity. Each floor is dedicated to different themes such as Indian heroes, renowned women personalities, saints, and religious harmony. The temple features a unique map of undivided India made from diverse stones and offers mesmerizing views.

reviews.reviewText: Very nice place. Although lift system to visit different floor is much crowded. It has a long queue and Waiting time. But one can use staircase also to visit each floor if you are fit.

It's a 8 storey building dedicated by lead prime minister Indira Gandhi. There is lift.  They charge rupees 5 for availing the lift facility. You may have to go to the 7th floor once you have taken the ticket. From there on you need to visit floor by floor. Each floor depicts the idols of freedom fighters, various gods, Saints, religions etc. It may take approximately an hour to comfortably see and read all information.

There is no dedicated parking. People park the vehicle in the road side.
Wash room situated outside the premises is well maintained.

Approach road is narrow.

Its a seven storeyed building consisting of various floors where different temples are made. Its a temple made of various famous personalities who contributed to welfare of India.
Lift is available.
The idol of Bharat Mata is placed in centre of temple at ground floor.
Parking facility is available.
Washroom facilities can be availed outside of it only.
Drinking water facility is there.
One time visit place!

Wonderful temple with unique status of all over Indias great persons.
From top to down floor there are different demonstration of the famous person.

Bharat Mata Temple in Haridwar is an interesting and unique multi-story shrine dedicated to Mother India, standing out among the usual temples of the city. The concept is patriotic and educational, with each of its eight floors showcasing different themes‚Äîranging from freedom fighters and revered women of India to saints from various religions and deities from Hindu mythology. The structure itself is impressive, and the views from the top are quite nice.

However, I found the overall experience to be just average. While the lift is convenient for reaching higher floors (with a small fee), coming down requires taking the stairs, which may be difficult for elderly visitors. The temple can sometimes get crowded, and the atmosphere, although culturally rich, doesn‚Äôt always feel very spiritual. Cleanliness and maintenance were decent, but nothing extraordinary, and there‚Äôs little guidance or signage to help visitors fully appreciate the significance of each floor.

In summary, Bharat Mata Temple is worth a visit for its concept and architecture, especially if you have an interest in Indian history and culture. But don‚Äôt expect a deeply spiritual experience or top-notch facilities. Overall, a satisfactory stop in Haridwar, but not a must-see if you‚Äôre short on time.

Its very different temple. It has 5 floors. You need to by the ticket of rs. 5 for the lift. And can visit every floor. There are different statues in every floor with different themes. It will take around 20 minutes.

Visited the beautiful Bharat Mandir in Haridwar, a serene place with 7 floors of divine energy. Each floor is dedicated to different deities, and the 7th floor holds a peaceful Shiv temple. The view from the top is absolutely mesmerising ‚Äì you can see the city of Haridwar and the holy Ganga flowing below, creating a truly spiritual experience.
Temple timings: 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM. A soulful and scenic visit!

Temple is nice but full of devotees...  There are atleast 6 floors inside the temple .. each one have diffrent kinds of statues there of great leaders and great personalities.. visiting there is kind a  having a great time.üëç

placeMetadata.name: Shree Daksheshwar Mahadev - Daksh Prajapati Temple

sources.snippet: A famous temple in Kankhal, Haridwar Daksha Mahadev Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is swarmed by devotees in the auspicious month of Sawan in August. The temple is named after King Daksha Prajapati, the father of Sati who was the first wife of Lord Shiva. Daksha is one of the 14 Prajapatis, creator deities, who preside over procreation and are the protector of life in Hindu mythology.

placeMetadata.description: Multicolored temple beside the River Ganges, featured in Hindu mythology & dedicated to Lord Shiva.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Shree Daksheshwar Mahadev - Daksh Prajapati Temple is a vibrant and significant Hindu temple situated near the River Ganges. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva and holds historical importance related to the tale of King Daksha, Sati, and Lord Shiva.
placeMetadata.address: Daksheshwar Mahadev Temple, Kankhal, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249407, India

reviews.reviewText: The temple where Mata sati was born and also the same place where she jumped into the hawan kund, when mahadev is insulted by his father. After listening to this that Mata sati is no more mahadev incarnate veerbhadra one of his most aggressive and powerful entity and command him to kill prajapati daksh,and also command him if any God, Gandharva, army, demi God came up in his way then also kill them but don't stop.. so veerbhadra defeated the whole army and tear them like a piece of paper and killed the prajapati daksh by his single attack and separate his head from his body. After that mahadeb took Mata sati body and roamed in the entire world here and there , and seeing this lord Vishnu start cutting Mata sati body in many parts and each part fallen down on earth and where the all 108 pieces are fall are today's known as shaktipeeth..

Where Divinity Meets Eternity ‚Äì Daksheswar Mahadev Temple, Kankhal

In the serene heart of Kankhal, Haridwar, lies Daksheswar Mahadev Temple ‚Äî more than just a temple, it is a place where myth and divinity quietly breathe as one. This sacred site holds deep significance in Hindu mythology, marking the place where King Daksha performed his yajna and where Goddess Sati, overcome with grief and devotion, surrendered herself to the sacred fire.

The temple echoes the divine tale of Lord Shiva‚Äôs sorrow, the creation of Virbhadra, and the eternal love between Shiva and Sati ‚Äî a story of cosmic energy, sacrifice, and spiritual union. Even today, the energy here is palpable ‚Äî peaceful yet deeply powerful.

As you walk through the temple‚Äôs corridors, you don‚Äôt just witness devotion‚Ä¶ you feel it. The gentle chimes of the bells, the fragrance of incense, and the chants in the air transport you to another realm. It‚Äôs a place where time slows down, where the heart feels light, and where the spirit quietly bows.

A must-visit for every spiritual traveler, devotee, or seeker of divine peace. Daksheswar Mahadev Temple is not just a destination ‚Äî it‚Äôs a divine moment carved into the heart of Haridwar.

Review by @the_solo_wanderer_
For more stories and spiritual travel moments, search me on Instagram. üåøüì∏

This is one of the good places to visit in haridwar but even if you don't come then it's also fine.

It has a ganga river flowing in behind which makes this place attractive. Other temples are also present but most of them are operated by lalchi pujari who forces bhakts to donate.

Temple flooring is being constructed again,now it looks beautiful but it can be made more beautiful.

This is the place where Sati mata was born and jumped into Hawan kund when Daksh prajapati insulted Mahadev Infront of Sati Mata. This is very peaceful temple. It's situated in Kankhal near by haridwar if you visit haridwar then must visit kankhal.

It is one of the most peaceful and spiritually powerful places in Haridwar.

The temple has a deep connection with ancient history and mythology, especially the story of Sati and Lord Shiva. The energy here is very strong, and you feel a deep sense of devotion the moment you enter.

The temple is clean, well-maintained, and beautifully built. There‚Äôs a calm atmosphere around, and it‚Äôs usually not very crowded, so you can peacefully do darshan and spend some time in meditation or prayer.

It‚Äôs a must-visit for Shiva devotees and anyone interested in spiritual or historical places. A truly divine experience! üôèüèªüí´

Daksheshwar Mahadev Temple, commonly known as Daksha Mahadev Temple, is one of the most revered and historically rich temples located in Kankhal, a sacred town near Haridwar, Uttarakhand. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, this temple holds immense spiritual and mythological significance, attracting devotees, pilgrims, and history lovers from across the country throughout the year.

This ancient temple is believed to be built at the very site where King Daksha Prajapati, father of Sati (Goddess Parvati), performed the famous Yajna (sacrifice) that led to the tragic self-immolation of Sati and Lord Shiva's immense grief and rage. According to Hindu mythology, this event is pivotal as it led to the creation of the powerful divine entity, Lord Veerabhadra, and eventually the reunion of Shiva and Sati. The temple thus holds a deep emotional and symbolic significance for followers of Shaivism and Hinduism at large.

The architecture of Daksheshwar Temple is simple yet elegant. The sanctum sanctorum houses a sacred Shiva Lingam, around which the temple structure has been built. The white walls with golden detailing, red shikhara (spire), and beautifully maintained premises create a serene atmosphere ideal for prayer and reflection. The temple is surrounded by other smaller shrines and a sacred pond, enhancing its spiritual charm.

Visitors appreciate the calmness of the temple complex, despite its popularity. Devotees often engage in Rudra Abhishek and other rituals, which are performed with devotion by the temple priests. During the Maha Shivaratri and Shravan months, the temple witnesses a surge in pilgrims, and the air becomes electrified with chants of ‚ÄúOm Namah Shivaya.‚Äù

The temple management is known for its cleanliness, organized rituals, and informative displays for visitors. Clean washrooms, shoe racks, and shaded waiting areas make the visit comfortable even during peak hours. Adequate security and friendly staff ensure a smooth spiritual experience.

In addition to its religious significance, the temple is located close to other prominent sites like Sati Kund and Birbhadra Temple, making it part of an enriching spiritual circuit in Haridwar.

Conclusion:
Daksheshwar Mahadev Temple is not just a place of worship but a gateway into the profound mythology and devotion embedded in Hindu tradition. Its sacred atmosphere, historical relevance, and peaceful surroundings make it a must-visit for anyone seeking spiritual solace or insight into India‚Äôs ancient heritage.

It was built in 1810 and rebuilt in 1962, it features the historic yajna kund and a serene sacred lake where pilgrims perform jalabhishek and ritual dips in the Ganges
. Nestled alongside the Das‚ÄØMahavidya shrine.

Shree Dhaksheshwar Mahadev  Temple  located in ,Kankhal, haridwar,
It's aporox 6KM from Chandi Pull,

placeMetadata.name: Chandi Ghat

sources.snippet: There are four main Ghats in Haridwar namely; Har ki Pauri (also known as Brahma Kund and renowned for the Maha Aarti on the banks of River Ganga), Gau Ghat (commonly visited for granting forgiveness for the sin of killing cows for food and formally celebrated event of donating cows), Ashti Parvath Ghat (used mainly to float ashes of the dead), Shubhash Ghat followed by Vishnu Ghat, Ramghat, Chandi Ghat, Kushavarta Ghat, Narayani Ghat, and Ramghat. In addition to spiritual awakening, Ghats have historical significance, making them important places to visit to understand local culture and social structure.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Haridwar for Travelling Architect - Page 2 of 2

placeMetadata.description: Waterfront area popular for picnics, with colorful ground murals & steps leading down to the river.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chandi Ghat is a serene waterfront area along the Ganga River, known for its colorful ground murals and steps leading down to the river. It's a popular spot for picnics and offers a quiet place to spend time near the river. The ghat is less crowded, providing a peaceful atmosphere to enjoy the scenic views of the river. Additionally, there are modern infrastructure and facilities available, including changing rooms, parking, and shops nearby.

reviews.reviewText: Truly peaceful and beautiful place. The serene atmosphere by the river, especially during the evening aarti, is an experience like no other. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to soak in the spiritual vibes of this sacred location. The ghat is well-maintained, and the view of the river along with the temples around creates a mesmerizing scene.

A peaceful ghat at the foothills of chandi Mata temple on the mountain.
Far less congested than har ki Paur, actually calm and relaxing. It may be too isolated for some but it was soothing for me. Definitely go there and enjoy the relaxing vibe.

A peaceful, uncrowded destination where you can witness a beautiful sunset from the ghat. The best times to visit are during sunset or early morning, when the atmosphere is pleasant, perfect for meditation. It's an ideal spot for friends, families, and couples to enjoy and have a peaceful time.

Peaceful and less crowded compared to Har Ki Pauri. Clean surroundings with proper ghats for bathing and rituals. Evening Ganga Aarti is serene and spiritual. Well-maintained area with good lighting and security. Ideal for a calm spiritual experience by the river

Chandi Ghat in Haridwar is a sacred and spiritual destination that offers a serene experience. Located on the banks of the Ganges River, this ghat is a popular spot for devotees and tourists alike. The ghat has undergone significant development, including a Rs 69.18-crore project under the Namami Gange initiative, which has created a beautiful and spacious area for visitors,

What you can do at Chandi Ghat:

1.You must take a Holy Dip: Immerse yourself in the sacred waters of the Ganges River, which is believed to wash away sins and bring spiritual enlightenment.
2.Witness the sacred Ganga Aarti: Attend the evening aarti ceremony, which is a mesmerizing experience with chanting, music, and diyas (earthen lamps) floating on the river.
3.Explore the Surroundings: Take a stroll along the ghat, visit nearby temples, and enjoy the scenic views of the river and the surrounding hills.
4. Attend Cultural Events: Chandi Ghat hosts various cultural events and festivals throughout the year, including the Ganga Utsav, which celebrates the Ganges River as India's National River.

Insights & Overview:

1. Chandi Ghat is located near Har Ki Pauri, another popular ghat in Haridwar.
2.The ghat is well-maintained and clean, with facilities for devotees and tourists.
3. It's a great spot for photography, especially during sunrise and sunset.
4.Be respectful of the local customs and traditions, and dress modestly when visiting the ghat.
Overall this ghat is neat and clean than popular Har Ki Pauri ghat. So must see place for all age group people.

Amazing ghat with complete wheelchair access and well thought of  for elderly people.

The ghat has ramps right from entry till Ganga Ji making it accessible for everyone.

The place is extremely beautiful and has ample parking nearby, a small local market and is very neat and clean.

Only issue is that the water is not deep, and most river was shallow and rocky, at least when I visited and hence taking dip was a cumbersome process as compared to Har Ki Pauri.

I visited Chandi Ghat with my office colleagues, and it turned out to be an unforgettable experience. The natural beauty of this place is beyond words! The pure, serene water flowing by the ghat and the peaceful atmosphere created a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The view of the river and the surrounding environment is truly calming and picturesque. Whether you're looking for a moment of peace by the riverbank or just want to soak in the spiritual vibes of Haridwar, Chandi Ghat offers it all. It's a place where nature and spirituality come together beautifully.

What made the visit even more special was the warmth of the local vendors. They were kind, humble, and always ready with a smile, making sure everyone felt welcome. The street food was also delicious, and it was great to see how much care they put into serving their customers. It made the overall experience even more enjoyable.

I highly recommend visiting Chandi Ghat for anyone who is in Haridwar‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre looking for tranquility, natural beauty, or a little spiritual refreshment, this place offers it all. It‚Äôs a great spot for both relaxation and reflection. Don‚Äôt miss out on this hidden gem!

Visiting Chandi Devi Temple, perched atop the Shivalik Hills, is a truly captivating experience. The journey itself, whether by cable car or the trek, offers breathtaking panoramic views of Haridwar and the majestic Ganges River. Once at the temple, the powerful and serene atmosphere envelops you, creating a sense of deep reverence. The legends and the spiritual energy of the deity, Chandi Devi, are palpable, leaving you feeling both humbled and uplifted. It's a beautiful blend of natural splendor and profound spirituality, making the visit a memorable and enriching one.

placeMetadata.name: Pashupati Mahadev Mandir

sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Haridwar for Travelling Architect - Page 2 of 2

placeMetadata.address: Hanuman Ghat Rd, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

reviews.reviewText: While taking a leisurely walk along Haridwar Motichur Road, I came across a signboard directing me to a temple. Curiosity led me to visit, and I was absolutely amazed. The Pashupati Mahadev Mandir is a hidden gem that many visitors to Haridwar may not know about or have had the chance to see, but it truly is a magnificent place. I highly recommend visiting‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience you won‚Äôt want to miss.
Must visited place in motichur bazar. Mythical temple.

Pashupati Mahadev temple between Vishnu ghat and Har ki Pori and entrance is from narrow market road in Motibazar only. There is another temple in same name located in residential area, about 2 km from BHEL and some photos are posted there also. These are two different temples.
Please identify the wishlist to visit the temple.

This temple is located at Shravannath Math in Moti Bazar and has two entrance.  You can ask anyone for the directions if google map doesnt help. Built by the king of Nepal and the Shivalinga here is similar to that of Pashupatinath temple of Nepal.There are only two temples in world one is in Nepal and other one is this(one and only in India) .
Must visit here if you are traveling to Haridwar.
Beautiful temple , clean,well maintained and you will feel energy and vibe there.

The one of the oldest  Lord Shiva temple in India, With huge Bull of single stone, It has two different entrance, one from moti Bazar , Ram Ghat road, another from Hanuman Ghat side. Pashupati nath is either in Nepal or in Haridwar.
Located in haridwar at bazaar road opposite to manasa devi rope way, must visit historical place in haridwar, without visit this place haridwar visit incomplete

This shiva temple is of its unique history, it is build at around 200 years back by Nepal King just like the Nepal's pashupati nath temple. Very high divine energy could be felt here. Totally blissful place for spiritual seekers.

The Pashupatinath temple located at Shravannath Math in Moti Bazar, Haridwar was built 199 years ago in the year 1876 by Raja Rajendra Vikram Singh, the then king of Nepal. Just as the stone of Shivling of Pashupatinath temple of Nepal is considered as Paras stone, similarly the stone of Shivling of Haridwar temple is also of Paras stone. After Nepal, Pashupatinath's temple is only in Haridwar. There is not a third temple like these temples in the whole world.  Shivalinga is considered a replica of Nepal's temple in Pashupatinath temple built in Haridwar, on the lines of Pashupatinath temple of Nepal. The status of Pashupatinath Temple in Haridwar is considered as much as the Pashupatinath Temple in Nepal. The virtuous benefit that will be gained from the darshan of Dwadash Jyotirlinga Pashupatinath Mahadev at Kathmandu, the same benefit will be obtained from the Darshan at the Pashupatinath temple located at Shravannath Math in Moti Bazaar, Haridwar.

placeMetadata.name: Shri Chintamani Parshvanath Digambar Jain Temple

sources.snippet: One of the prominent Jain temples in Haridwar, this temple holds a special significance for the Jain community but is visited by people from all faiths owing to its distinct architecture, which gives it a unique identity. The divine aura, aesthetics, and magnificence of this region leave you in awe and enhances the holiness of this temple. The temple came up in the early 1990s with the blessings of Saint Padam Sagar Suri Maharaj and it also marked the end to the long-pending aspirations of Jains for a spot in Haridwar.

placeMetadata.address: W4F5+32R, Shyam Nagar, Jwalapur, Uttarakhand 249407, India

reviews.reviewText: During my journey from Haridwar to Rishikesh, I accidentally saw this temple. The architecture of this temple is really superb. It is located around 2 or 3 km away from the Hari ki Paudi.
Superb work...... On road heavy traffic near by. But if you find Dharamshala nearby the it will be best time spent with family

A highlight for visitors is the daily Ganga Aarti, a spiritual ceremony held at sunrise and sunset. During this ritual, priests perform prayers with fire bowls, accompanied by the resonating sounds of temple bells and chants. The evening aarti, in particular, attracts large crowds, creating a mesmerizing and spiritually uplifting atmosphere.
Awesome experience with divine aura
No words can explain the feeling of being here. Place is so full of calmness and divine vibes. Every moment spent here brings some kind of peace within you. The evening Ganga arti is wholesome.
A peaceful place, go there take a bath in Ganga Maiya water and sit there and feel the inner peace

Har Ki Pauri is one of the most sacred ghats of Haridwar and the only place where all spiritual activities take place. It is believed that this ghat was built in the first century BC by King Vikramaditya in the memory of his brother Brithari. Literal meaning of the word 'Har Ki Pauri' - "Har" means "Lord Shiva", "Ki" means "of" and "Pauri" means "Stairs".
Watch tower in haridwar top visit place in india
